About WAVE

The Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool (WAVE) is developed by WebAIM, a leading organization in digital accessibility since 1999. It helps authors and teams identify accessibility issues and improve compliance with standards like WCAG, ADA, and the EU Accessibility Directive.

WAVE is a suite of tools designed to help you make your web content more accessible. While WAVE cannot determine if your content is fully accessible, only a human can, it plays a critical role in helping you evaluate and improve it.

WebAIM’s philosophy is to focus on issues that truly impact end users, facilitate meaningful human evaluation, and promote accessibility education.

Explore WAVE

Users

We are really proud that our users also come from big companies and big brands around the world and are using Web Performance Report to monitor the web performance of their websites every week from their inboxes. 🎉

Report Catalog

WebPageTest Report

WebPageTest is the gold‑standard opensource web performance tool, enabling developers to monitor and optimize site performance.

Get the report

HTTP Observatory Report

Developed by Mozilla, the HTTP Observatory performs an in-depth assessment of a site’s HTTP headers and other key security configurations.

Get the report

WAVE Report

WAVE helps identify accessibility issues and supports compliance with standards like WCAG, ADA, and the EU Accessibility Directive.

Get the report

Web Accessibility Report

Web Accessibility Report Details

Contrast Checker. Link Contrast Checker

Accessibility Summary

Each icon, box, and piece of information added by WAVE presents some information about the accessibility of your page.

Accessibility Error Details

Red Errors indicate issues that will impact certain users with disabilities.

Accessibility Alert Details

Yellow alerts indicate elements in the page that may cause accessibility issues.

Accessibility Aria Details

ARIA can be used to present important accessibility information to people with disabilities, but it must be used very carefully.
